item.description:
The Art in Bloom,at the Brighton-Allston Heritage Museum, with 8 established artists and 75 paintings, sculptures and floral arrangements, opened on Saturday, May 22nd. Over 100 people viewed the exhibit with a horticultural, garden and green space theme from the 19th century to the 21st century. The artists include: Julie Hom-Mandell John McCarthy, Pat O'Brien, Shelley Reed, Kathryn Sanfilippo, Barbara Sawin, Maggie Schmidt and Phillip Spinks. The Exhibit runs through July 17. The exhibit also includes a 19th century designed garden, a slideshow from the Brighton Garden and Horticultural Society's garden tours and plant sales in the past 8 years, and historical seed catalogue covers and other historic documents from the 19th century with many loaned items from the Massachusetts Horticultural Society.

Most of the artworks are also for sale. After we tour the exhibit, we adjourn to a local coffee shop for coffee and dessert.
